Problem:
Consider an electrical circuit modeled with a complex function \\( Z(s) \\) representing impedance, and a Laplace transformation \\( L \\) which converts time-domain functions into the s-domain. The action is analyzing the behavior of the current function \\( I(t) \\) when subjected to an input voltage \\( V(t) = V_0 e^{st} \\).

If a filter characterized by a transformation \\( F(s) = s / (s + a) \\) is applied as an intervention at time \\( t_1 \\), does the new current \\( I'(t) \\) for \\( T > t_1 \\) depend strictly on the initial voltage \\( V(t) \\) and not on the type of filter applied?
Explanation: The intervention with the filter \\( F(s) \\) modifies the circuit characteristics, changing the response of the system to the initial voltage. The current at any time \\( T > t_1 \\) will not only depend on the original voltage but also on the properties of the filter applied. Hence, both the initial conditions and the nature of the filter influence the outcome.
